channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Five Ways AI Can Transform How Businesses Interact With Consumers
item.description: Let’s discuss how AI could change how businesses interact with customers.

item.title: Adjacent but not relevant
item.description: There’s a sale on band saw blades, including a really good deal on one that fits the saw you owned years ago. The folks who live next door to the house you used to live in are having a raucous party. A guy with a name just like yours wins the lottery… These adjacencies can […]

item.title: The Anti-Spam Manifesto: A Business Leader's Guide To Earning Customer Trust
item.description: All in all, a trusted brand equals a successful brand. However, most don't know the secret ingredient to building and maintaining customer trust—ethical communication.

item.title: Silence vs noise
item.description: When a group comes together, noise is easy. Just a few people have to make a commotion for noise to happen. But silence requires everyone to be in sync.

item.title: A Guide To Enhance Customer Experience With Omnichannel Excellence In Contact Centers
item.description: A contact center’s ability to deliver better customer satisfaction plays a pivotal role in building a brand’s image.

item.title: Misunderstanding bigness
item.description: IBM spent a fortune fighting calls for them to be broken up. So did AT&T and Microsoft. In all three cases, there’s plenty of evidence that they would have been better off if they had simply broken themselves up. Microsoft is still recovering and IBM never will. One computer company, one phone company, one software […]

item.title: Navigating The Dark Waters: Understanding Cookiecutter Shark Encounters
item.description: Scientists suggest that artificial and natural lights might play a role in encounters with these sharks, advising swimmers to plan their dips carefully.

item.title: The challenge of “a risky scheme”
item.description: New ideas aren’t adopted all at once. A few people go first while the rest of us watch to see how it goes. “Look, Mikey, he likes it!” This is the story of tech innovations, dance crazes and even food. Ideas spread horizontally, and people who prefer the status quo will embrace an idea only […]

item.title: How A Universal Semantic Layer Helps AI Understand Data
item.description: AI projects depend heavily on accurate, performance-optimized, reliable data.

item.title: Learning in August
item.description: What better time? An hour a day for a month and you can learn a skill you’ll have forever. Beach reads are a fine way to chill out, but a month spent to learn a skill is a fine way to take advantage of a quiet time. My brand new course on Strategy is now […]
